segment.source: Connected Standby energy efficiency
segment.target: Connected Standby energy efficiency

segment.source: Connected Standby energy efficiency
segment.target: Connected Standby energy efficiency

segment.source: Connected Standby energy efficiency
segment.target: Connected Standby energy efficiency

segment.source: As part of the Battery life during connected standby job, the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment measures the impact of software and devices on the battery life of a system while it is in Connected Standby.
segment.target: As part of the Battery life during connected standby job, the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment measures the impact of software and devices on the battery life of a system while it is in Connected Standby.

segment.source: The assessment also measures the time spent transitioning into and out of Connected Standby.
segment.target: The assessment also measures the time spent transitioning into and out of Connected Standby.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Workloads
segment.target: Workloads

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: For more information about results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment.
segment.target: For more information about results and issues produced by this assessment, see Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment.

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.
segment.target: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.

segment.source: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.
segment.target: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.

segment.source: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.
segment.target: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: The system must support Connected Standby.
segment.target: The system must support Connected Standby.

segment.source: To verify that this sleep state is supported, open a command prompt window, and run the following command:
segment.target: To verify that this sleep state is supported, open a command prompt window, and run the following command:

segment.source: powercfg /a
segment.target: powercfg /a

segment.source: If your system supports Connected Standby, Standby (Connected) will be in the list of available sleep states.
segment.target: If your system supports Connected Standby, Standby (Connected) will be in the list of available sleep states.

segment.source: Ensure that the system is running on DC (battery) power.
segment.target: Ensure that the system is running on DC (battery) power.

segment.source: Energy efficiency jobs are designed to run only on mobile devices.
segment.target: Energy efficiency jobs are designed to run only on mobile devices.

segment.source: If a battery is not detected, you will receive an error.
segment.target: If a battery is not detected, you will receive an error.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: To run the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment on a Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1 device, you must do the following:
segment.target: To run the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment on a Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1 device, you must do the following:

segment.source: Insert a USB storage device into the computer running WAC.
segment.target: Insert a USB storage device into the computer running WAC.

segment.source: The storage device should have at least 60MB of available space.
segment.target: The storage device should have at least 60MB of available space.

segment.source: In WAC, package the assessment, and select the USB storage device as the target.
segment.target: In WAC, package the assessment, and select the USB storage device as the target.

segment.source: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: Transfer the USB storage device to the device that is running Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1.
segment.target: Transfer the USB storage device to the device that is running Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1.

segment.source: Copy the contents of the USB storage device to a destination on the device that is running Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1.
segment.target: Copy the contents of the USB storage device to a destination on the device that is running Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1.

segment.source: On the device that is running Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1, open a command prompt with administrator privileges.
segment.target: On the device that is running Windows RT or Windows RT 8.1, open a command prompt with administrator privileges.

segment.source: Navigate to the location of the assessment package.
segment.target: Navigate to the location of the assessment package.

segment.source: Navigate to the Assessment1arm directory.
segment.target: Navigate to the Assessment1arm directory.

segment.source: Run InstallKitsPolicy.cmd.
segment.target: Run InstallKitsPolicy.cmd.

segment.source: This will reboot the device.
segment.target: This will reboot the device.

segment.source: After reboot, navigate back to the root of the assessment package location, and run RunJob.cmd.
segment.target: After reboot, navigate back to the root of the assessment package location, and run RunJob.cmd.

segment.source: To remove the policy, do the following:
segment.target: To remove the policy, do the following:

segment.source: Navigate to the location of the assessment package.
segment.target: Navigate to the location of the assessment package.

segment.source: Navigate to the Assessment1arm directory.
segment.target: Navigate to the Assessment1arm directory.

segment.source: Run DeleteKitsPolicy.cmd.
segment.target: Run DeleteKitsPolicy.cmd.

segment.source: This will reboot the device.
segment.target: This will reboot the device.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Before you begin, configure the settings on the portable computer to reduce the risk of generating warnings in the results and adversely affecting power usage.
segment.target: Before you begin, configure the settings on the portable computer to reduce the risk of generating warnings in the results and adversely affecting power usage.

segment.source: The following guidelines are recommended settings.
segment.target: The following guidelines are recommended settings.

segment.source: They are not required for the job to run, but the results may be affected if the computer is not appropriately configured.
segment.target: They are not required for the job to run, but the results may be affected if the computer is not appropriately configured.

segment.source: Make sure that wireless functionality is enabled and that the computer is connected to a network.
segment.target: Make sure that wireless functionality is enabled and that the computer is connected to a network.

segment.source: Otherwise, the results might not reflect realistic scenarios.
segment.target: Otherwise, the results might not reflect realistic scenarios.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Manage Wireless Networks.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Manage Wireless Networks.

segment.source: If wireless functionality is not enabled, turn it on and connect to a wireless network.
segment.target: If wireless functionality is not enabled, turn it on and connect to a wireless network.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If wireless connectivity is on, but there is no network to connect to, results are still affected.
segment.target: If wireless connectivity is on, but there is no network to connect to, results are still affected.

segment.source: Install and enable antivirus software.
segment.target: Install and enable antivirus software.

segment.source: If antivirus software isn't enabled and running, the results might not reflect realistic scenarios.
segment.target: If antivirus software isn't enabled and running, the results might not reflect realistic scenarios.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Action Center, choose Security, and check that the Virus protection is On.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Action Center, choose Security, and check that the Virus protection is On.

segment.source: If not, choose Change Action Center Settings and then choose the Virus protection check box.
segment.target: If not, choose Change Action Center Settings and then choose the Virus protection check box.

segment.source: Make sure that the power policy is set to Balanced.
segment.target: Make sure that the power policy is set to Balanced.

segment.source: By default, any other power policy generates a warning that may affect the results.
segment.target: By default, any other power policy generates a warning that may affect the results.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Power Options, and then choose Balanced.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Power Options, and then choose Balanced.

segment.source: Make sure that the computer is configured so that a password isn't required when the computer resumes from a screen saver.
segment.target: Make sure that the computer is configured so that a password isn't required when the computer resumes from a screen saver.

segment.source: Make sure that all device drivers are correctly installed.
segment.target: Make sure that all device drivers are correctly installed.

segment.source: Results might vary significantly if your computer has missing or incorrect drivers.
segment.target: Results might vary significantly if your computer has missing or incorrect drivers.

segment.source: You can use the Driver Verification assessment to identify driver issues on the computer that you want to assess.
segment.target: You can use the Driver Verification assessment to identify driver issues on the computer that you want to assess.

segment.source: For best results, we recommend that you run the job as a packaged job.
segment.target: For best results, we recommend that you run the job as a packaged job.

segment.source: For information about how to create and run a packaged job, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For information about how to create and run a packaged job, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.source: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows RT
segment.target: Windows RT

segment.source: Windows RT 8.1
segment.target: Windows RT 8.1

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.

segment.source: Workloads
segment.target: Workloads

segment.source: A workload is a set of automated tasks that simulate user activity in a predefined, repeatable manner.
segment.target: A workload is a set of automated tasks that simulate user activity in a predefined, repeatable manner.

segment.source: The workloads run independent of each other.
segment.target: The workloads run independent of each other.

segment.source: You can select any combination of these workloads to run during the assessment.
segment.target: You can select any combination of these workloads to run during the assessment.

segment.source: This assessment measures durations and throughput for each workload that you use, and stores the metrics in the results file.
segment.target: This assessment measures durations and throughput for each workload that you use, and stores the metrics in the results file.

segment.source: The following table describes the workloads that are available for this assessment.
segment.target: The following table describes the workloads that are available for this assessment.

segment.source: Workload
segment.target: Workload

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Diagnostic mode
segment.target: Diagnostic mode

segment.source: Uses heavyweight tracing, generating additional tracing, metrics, and issues that are used to help diagnose energy efficiency problems.
segment.target: Uses heavyweight tracing, generating additional tracing, metrics, and issues that are used to help diagnose energy efficiency problems.

segment.source: If the Generate diagnostics information option is enabled under Energy efficiency settings, the first iteration runs in diagnostic mode.
segment.target: If the Generate diagnostics information option is enabled under Energy efficiency settings, the first iteration runs in diagnostic mode.

segment.source: Workload mode
segment.target: Workload mode

segment.source: Uses lightweight tracing.
segment.target: Uses lightweight tracing.

segment.source: Workload mode does not generate any metrics or issues.
segment.target: Workload mode does not generate any metrics or issues.

segment.source: If the Generate diagnostics information option is enabled under Energy efficiency settings, the first iteration runs in diagnostic mode, while the remaining iterations run in workload mode.
segment.target: If the Generate diagnostics information option is enabled under Energy efficiency settings, the first iteration runs in diagnostic mode, while the remaining iterations run in workload mode.

segment.source: Otherwise, all iterations run in workload mode.
segment.target: Otherwise, all iterations run in workload mode.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: Microsoft defines recommended settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: Microsoft defines recommended settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.

segment.source: If desired, you can change these settings.
segment.target: If desired, you can change these settings.

segment.source: The following table describes the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment settings.
segment.target: The following table describes the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment settings.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Minute(s)
segment.target: Minute(s)

segment.source: Specifies the amount of time per iteration, in minutes, that the computer will spend in Connected Standby.
segment.target: Specifies the amount of time per iteration, in minutes, that the computer will spend in Connected Standby.

segment.source: Disable Quiet Hours
segment.target: Disable Quiet Hours

segment.source: Specifies whether to disable the Quiet Hours feature during the assessment.
segment.target: Specifies whether to disable the Quiet Hours feature during the assessment.

segment.source: By default, the Quiet Hours feature is not disabled.
segment.target: By default, the Quiet Hours feature is not disabled.
